data.title: The Drowsy Chaperone
data.text:
“Silly? Yes. Inspired? Yes. A 1928 musical? No.” – Vancouver Sun

When a die-hard theatre fan plays his favourite cast album, the unforgettable characters come to life in one show-stopping song and dance number after another. This hilarious Tony-winning musical farce delightfully blends nostalgia with a contemporary flair.

Recommended for ages 12 and up.

Content advisories: Water-based haze, innuendo, adult humour (that may go over the heads of non-adults)

Click here to see the Visual Story for our Relaxed Performance

The Drowsy Chaperone is presented through special arrangement with Music Theatre International (MTI). All authorized performance materials are also supplied by MTI. www.mtishows.com

Music and Lyrics by Lisa Lambert and Greg Morrison

Book by Bob Martin and Don McKeller

Original Broadway production of The Drowsy Chaperone produced by Kevin McCollum, Roy Miller, Bob Boyett, Stephanie McClelland, Barbara Freitag and Jill Furman.

Directed & Choreographed by Dayna Tekatch*

Served as resident Director of the Canadian productions of Harry Potter and the Cursed Child and Come From Away

Music Directed by Jeff Poynter

Stage Manager: Aida Rae

Costume Designers: Indie Garrett & Mia Wistaff

Light Designer: Dalton Nelson & Elijah Bell

Sound Designer: Elijah Bell

Set Designers: Timothy Cameron & Katie Van Bergeyk

Assistant Director: Mia Wistaff

Assistant Stage Manager: Amanda Reyes

Dance Captain: Camély Rouleau

Props Master: Camély Rouleau

Communications & Marketing: Amanda Reyes & Gracie Vanthuyne

Business Manager: Gracie Vanthuyne

* The participation of this Artist is arranged by permission of Canadian Actors’ Equity Association under the provisions of the Dance•Opera•Theatre Policy.
